intro: Thesium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its small, linear leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or alpine environments. It is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Thesium parvifolium is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
